segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so focused on those cookies, completely unaware of how unstable that stool looks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit angry seeing him like that, so careless and reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He could fall at any moment, but he doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him is just as bad, encouraging him to take those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're both so caught up in their little scheme, not noticing the water all over the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder what they're thinking, standing there on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like they're in their own little world, untouched by the potential dangers around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around and sees them before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a bit disgusted by their lack of awareness, their complete disregard for safety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a strange scene, both innocent and slightly infuriating at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR
